column1: Table 4: Most used parameters to measure detrusor contraction in female patients

column2:
Hill equation of muscle 
contraction in a spherical 
organ, with fixed 
constants obtained from 
experimental and clinical 
studies
column3:
Eight asymptomatic 
female volunteers aged 
28–45 years (median 34 
years)
column4:
Ideal voiding (bell-shaped flow 
curves): WFmax 11-24 W/m2
Non-ideal voiding: WFmax  
5−10 W/m2
Normally WFmax > 7 W/m2 
(expert opinion, unspecified 
population) [474]

column1:
Projected isovolumetric 
pressure (cm H2O) and 
BCI, using PIP as an 
index [470, 475]
column2:
Bladder output relation, 
simplified to a straight line 
with fixed slope of  
5 cm H2O/mL/s (formula: 
PdetQmax + 5xQmax)
column3:
Unspecified population, 
mainly men with BPO
column4:
Classification based on expert 
opinion:
> 150: strong contraction
100–150: normal contraction
50–100: weak contraction
< 50: very weak contraction

column2:
Comparison of Qmax and 
PdetQmax values with stop 
test results
(Formula: pdetQmax + Qmax)
column4:
5th-95th percentile: 29–78 cm 
H2O
Mean: 49 cm H2O
Median: 48 cm H2O
Proposed typical values: 
30-75 cm H2O

column2:
